text: [Music]
hi this is Seema and today I am bringing
you a new lesson on job related idioms
and vocabulary we all know how important
a job is to all the fans don't we well
the other day I met a friend of mine
named Sarah who used to be a work
colleague of mine and I kind of didn't
see her much around and therefore the
first thing I asked her when I met her
was hi Sarah I hear you've been between
jobs is that true well what did I
actually mean when I told her that she
was between jobs between jobs Maine's
unemployed so what I was really asking
her is that Sarah have you been
unemployed for some time because that's
you know what I've actually heard and
well it turns out that it was true
unfortunately she told me that she was
tired of holding down a job what is
holding down a job mean it means
maintaining a job so what she was
telling me is that she was tired of
holding down a job during the day
because she was also moonlighting at the
same time what is moonlighting
moonlighting is basically working on a
second job working a second job at night
or maybe in the late evenings at night
or maybe the late evenings to make that
extra money so
moonlighting is basically something that
people do when they want to make extra
money because their job that they try to
maintain during the day does not pay
in knots while we all do that at some
point of time in our lives
probably Sarah had extra bills to pay
some credit cards to pay and I don't
believe her day job that she was trying
to hold down or maintain kind of helped
her pay those bills and therefore she
was moonlighting or working a second job
at night probably in the late evenings
after she finished the first one that
she did during the day um but the good
news she gave me was that she eventually
went to a headhunter
what is a headhunter a headhunter is a
professional executive job recruiter
oops
when a lot of times a lot of times when
we try to find a job by ourselves we're
kind of not very successful because we
don't really know how to go about it
but a headhunter is a professional job
recruiter who will help you get the
right job according to your work profile
so my friend Sarah met this headhunter
who helped her eventually land a job or
obtain a job so landing a job means
obtaining a job and the good news is
that the headhunter landed her a job or
the executive job recruiter helped her
obtain a job which kind of helped her in
you know increase of salary which means
the new job that she got was almost
equal to the pay of both and that's good
news isn't it well I hope these five
idioms are kind of clear to you I will
be back with some more job-related
idioms and vocabulary well speaking of
Sarah now that we know she's got a new
job she also goes ahead to tell me that
she now has various perks associated
with the job so what are perks
they are benefits that come with the job
or job benefits so what our job benefits
actually well when you are employed you
may get travel allowance you could get
food coupons maybe well that'sthat's a
benefit for sure all of us are like to
eat how about insurance
very important another benefit um and a
lot many other benefits like incentives
maybe so you work more you get paid
extra more than what you were supposed
to get so incentives so not only she got
a new job or landed a new job for
herself but she got job-related benefits
including all these that's what a perk a
job perks are called pay hike well the
good news is that she got a pay hike or
a raise in her salary and she was really
happy about it now wouldn't we all be if
we got a pay hike very good thing to
gain um and she tells me that her job is
so good her new job is so good that she
gets to knock off early if she gets her

knocking off early means getting to

knock off early so I may have a job from

of her dreams and I was really happy for

all you know after all this time I know
she's been working very hard or working
like a dog as you may put it so working
like a dog means working very hard oh
you can also use another idiom like
working like a maniac so getting a couse
job or an easy job or a job of your
dreams after working like a dog or
working very hard is kind of really good
